text: It will append query parameters to the URL of the iframe for use. Similar to `propertiesToSend` if you're familiar with other CRM development tools.

Oh thanks!
I need, in the link I open in the iframe (which is a page under my control on HubSpot), to know if that page was opened through the CRM card. Currently, I pass a value in the query, but it's not secure. I should create a protected page that can only be accessed through an iframe opened on the CRM card (I'm working on an integration for operators), so I can pass some parameters or perform a check on some cookies. Can you advise me on this?

Yeah you should be able to change the CSP / etc policy to only allow the page to be loaded on <http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com>
I'd checkout <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Frame-Options> and <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Security-Policy/frame-ancestors>

it's easy to change in only in a HubSpot page?
My iframe link is hosted in HubSpot too
